result.execSummary:
The defendant Terry L Micoley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Terry L Micoley

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: Defendant Terry L Micoley in court with attorney Michael Scholke.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 11:18 AM. Called 16CF113 and 16CM93. Court - on 16CM93 - looks like the defendant wold be pleading NC to count #1 and asks what is happening with count #2. State - #2 is DRI. State - on 16CF113 - pleading G/NC to count #1 as amended to battery contrary to 940.19(1)(a), dismiss and read in count #2. Court has plea questionnaire, amends count #1 to battery contrary to 940.19(1)(a) and finds thru the plea questionnaire that the defendant is pleading NC to count #1 on 16CF113 as amended and to count #1 on 16CM93 as alleged. Court dismisses and reads in counts #2 on each of the cases and explains what it means for a count to be DRI. Court goes thru plea questionnaire, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. Schoelke states that count #1 on 16CM93 will be a $300 fine plus costs and on count #1 of 16CF113 - $500.00 fine plus costs. State has complied with victim notification requirements - no VIS - surprised they are not here today - makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation of: fine of $300.00 on count #1 on 16CM93 and a $500.00 fine plus costs on count #1 on 16CF113, not asking for any jail time or probation for stated reasons. Scholke makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Micoley makes statement, counsel covered everything. Court sentences the defendant to the following: count #1 on 16CM93 - $300.00 fine plus costs and surcharges - 60 DTP/CO, on count #1 on 16CF113 - $500.00 fine plus costs and surcharges - 60 DTP/CO, submit DNA sample, right to appeal, adjourned.
Status conference on May 23, 2017 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on May 23, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Terry L Micoley in court with attorney Michael Scholke.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:10 PM. Scholke - not resolved - ask for JT. Court continues bond and sets for JT. Court called 16CM93 at 1:15 PM. Scholke and Micoley have complaint, waives reading of it, puts as STC on JT date that was just for 16CF113. State - bond - signature bond with no consumption of alcohol. Scholke - no objections. Court - bond - $750.00 signature bond, no consumption of alcohol.  Status conference scheduled for May 23, 2017 at 08:30 am.
